channel.title: How do I make custom objects? 317+
channel.description: I have the model for the Dungeoneering cape sitting on the wooden display stand, and I want to have a "take from" option, and have it give an item. Like I said, I have all the models, I just don't know where to put the ints in.

item.title: How do I make custom objects? 317+
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:5, topic:366966”][quote author=stickywicky link=topic=463161.msg3387934#msg3387934 date=1288646835]
ok no need to be mad just becasue i couldnt help you jeez… any way if you check i have posted about 3 posts about that problem and yesstill havnt got a valid reply
[/quote]

There’s plenty need. I was asking a question, and you decided to hijack my thread and ask for help on your little issue. You could just as easily post on your thread. I still would have gotten a notification in my “new replies to your posts”. And just because you haven’t gotten a valid reply does not mean you can go posting on someone else’s thread to get your information. Be patient, we all have to. If you couldn’t help me, refrain from posting.[/quote]
Someone’s a little irritated?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make custom objects? 317+

item.title: How do I make custom objects? 317+
item.dc:creator: @xaviergmail xaviergmail
item.description:
@xaviergmail wrote:

Hey class46
Under

class46.method573(); class46.method582(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_753);
add[code]if(i == ) { // Object ID you want to replace with your object / model.
aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_753.anInt1406 = anIntArray755[630]; // Ignore
class46.method582(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_753); // Ignore
class46.aStringArray786 = new String[5]; // Object Action Array. You can leave it as 5.
class46.aStringArray786[0] = ""; // Object Action.
class46.aString739 = “Cordon”; // Object Name
class46.aByteArray777 = "*************".getBytes(); // Examine Object.
class46.anIntArray773= new int[1]; // How many models to load. Leave it as 1.
class46.anIntArray773[0] = **********; // Model ID your replacing it with. ( Model in your model folder )

    }[/code]

I found this on runeblablabla
For some reasons, it wont work with iClarity 1.1 client, anyways use it and if it doesen’t work add xb0x-36o@hotmail.com

Read full topic
